hero.title: Built to demystify everyday Thai banking decisions
hero.description: Basic Financial Calculator started as a learning project to help friends compare interest, value, and loans. This new version continues that mission: make calculations accessible, safe, and non-commercial.

mission.title: Why this project exists
paragraphs: The legacy site made it simple to calculate simple interest, compound growth, present and future value, and loan payments without spreadsheets or sign-ups.
This version retains that simplicity, adding decimal precision and best practices aligned with Thailand's financial system.

savings.title: Savings deposit calculator
savings.subtitle: Calculate Actual/365 accrual with biannual payouts and latest BOT reference rates.

mode.simple: Year {{year}}: Simple due to 20,000 THB rule

savings.noPayouts: No payout dates fall inside the selected range.

notes.title: Notes
notes.first: Days in the first payout period are counted from 1 January through 29 June inclusive — 180 days in a 365-day year.
notes.second: The second payout period counts days from 30 June through 30 December inclusive — 184 days.
notes.third: If the total interest received from all savings accounts from the same bank exceeds 20,000 baht in that tax year, the bank is required to withhold 15% income tax at source.
notes.fourth: The calculator automatically applies 15% withholding tax when cumulative interest at a payout exceeds 20,000 THB. Once the threshold is crossed, tax is withheld so that the total withheld equals 15% of the entire YTD gross interest. Subsequent payouts in the same year are taxed at 15% on their full gross amounts.

savings.agreement: All calculations use the Asia/Bangkok time zone.

info.title: How we calculate savings deposit interest
info.subtitle: We use the Actual/365 day-count method with biannual interest payouts.

method.title: Actual/365 method
method.description: Interest accrues daily based on actual calendar days divided by 365.

payouts.title: Biannual payouts
payouts.description: Interest is paid on June 30 and December 30 each year.

threshold.title: 20,000 THB threshold
threshold.description: If total interest from the same bank exceeds 20,000 THB in a year, 15% withholding tax applies.

compounding.title: Compounding rules
compounding.description: Interest compounds at payout unless the 20,000 THB threshold is crossed, then switches to simple interest.

fixed.title: Fixed deposit calculator
fixed.subtitle: Calculate fixed-term simple-interest deposits with optional rollovers and tax summaries.
fixed.disclaimer: Early withdrawal penalties vary by bank; bank-specific terms may apply.

info.title: How we calculate fixed deposit interest
info.subtitle: We use simple interest for each fixed term with optional compounding on rollover.
info.formula: Interest = Principal \times Annual\ Rate \times \frac{Term\ in\ months}{12}

simple.title: Simple interest
simple.description: Interest is calculated once at maturity based on the fixed term and rate.

rollover.title: Rollover options
rollover.description: You can choose to compound interest when rolling over to the next term.

tax.title: Withholding tax
tax.description: 15% withholding tax is applied to interest earned if enabled.

term.title: Fixed term
term.description: Deposits are locked for specific periods (e.g., 3, 6, 12, 24 months) with predetermined rates.

tiered.hint: Define balance ranges and their corresponding interest rates. Tiers should not overlap.

validation.atLeastOneTier: At least one tier must be defined
validation.minLessThanMax: Minimum balance must be less than maximum balance

info.title: How we calculate tiered deposit interest
info.subtitle: We apply different interest rates to balance ranges, calculating each tier separately.
info.formula: Total\ Interest = \sum (Amount\ in\ tier \times Rate\ for\ tier \times Time)

tiers.title: Interest tiers
tiers.description: Your balance is divided into ranges, each with its own interest rate.

calculation.title: Per-tier calculation
calculation.description: Each portion of your balance earns interest at its corresponding tier rate.

example.title: Example
example.description: If you have 150,000 THB with tier 1 (0-50k at 0.5%) and tier 2 (50k-200k at 1.5%), you earn 0.5% on the first 50k and 1.5% on the remaining 100k.

time.title: Time period
time.description: Interest accrues over the deposit period using the Actual/365 day-count method.
